number of helpful: 8 of 10 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 8, 2014
												ProtoGalaxy is a classic example of a shootemup or bullethell game, it reminds me of pretty much every classic arcade  rail shooter I have ever played. one major difference here is that there is a map builder and story missions, those are a pretty neat addition.  ProtoGalaxy looks super old, and there is no multiplayer community whatsoever, but the game is free so that is another plus, it provides a decent amount of single player fun and I would recommend anyone interested in the classic arcade feeling of the game to go ahead and give it a try.  I have not had any problems with the game besides the Steam achievements not working.

content:
Posted: June 3, 2011
												A fairly fun scrolling shooter with a lot of ship customization. It lacks a bit of polish, and the upgrading system is kind of confusing, after you get the hang of it, you should be fine. It features four-player co-op as well (even local co-op), which is always a plus. It might not be worth the $9.99 price tag, but I'd say it's worth the $3.40 sale price for sure.

number of helpful: 4 of 6 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 4, 2011
												Protogalaxy did not impress me. It's a pretty straightforward arcade game: seperate controls for moving and firing; try to manage both as best as you can while you're being bombarded by up to a dozen enemies at once.The tutorial it thin. But what really put me off is that it's the kind of game where you might play a 5-minute level for 4:30, fail at the end, and then have to start the entire level over. Bleh. The repetition is painful.I do not recommend this game.
